title: Rides & Attractions
description: How well do you know Disney's iconic rides?

questions.question: What classic attraction warns 'there's a great big beautiful tomorrow'?
questions.explanation: Carousel of Progress features the song 'There's a Great Big Beautiful Tomorrow,' written by the Sherman Brothers.

questions.question: Space Mountain was one of the original attractions when Magic Kingdom opened.
questions.explanation: Space Mountain opened in 1975, four years after Magic Kingdom opened in 1971.

questions.question: What is the name of the mountain with the Yeti at Animal Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Expedition Everest features a legendary Yeti guarding the Forbidden Mountain in the Himalayas.

questions.question: Which ride replaced Splash Mountain?
questions.explanation: Tiana's Bayou Adventure, themed to The Princess and the Frog, replaced Splash Mountain.

questions.question: How many happy haunts reside in the Haunted Mansion?
questions.explanation: The Haunted Mansion is home to 999 happy haunts, but there's always room for one more!

questions.question: Pirates of the Caribbean inspired the movie franchise, not the other way around.
questions.explanation: The ride opened in 1967, and the first Pirates of the Caribbean film came out in 2003, inspired by the attraction.

questions.question: What Star Wars land opened at Disneyland and Hollywood Studios?
questions.explanation: Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge opened in 2019, set on the planet Batuu in the Star Wars universe.

questions.question: What EPCOT attraction takes you on a journey through time and communication?
questions.explanation: Spaceship Earth, housed in EPCOT's iconic geodesic sphere, chronicles the history of human communication.
